> Things inside fairings (payloads+engines) are subtracted from drag. That, and a few balance changes, is all I expect. I'll give it a try, but no doubt I'll be installing FAR and some version of RSS as soon as they update.

Do you realize how absurd what you just said is ? Saying that you will install FAR anyway for 1.0 WHATEVER the stock aero upgrades will be is really the same as saying that you don't trust squad at all and that what they do sucks... Maybe that is what you think, but then why do you even play KSP...?

Maybe you'll prefer the new stock aero over FAR, who knows ? you have no clue until 1.0 is out, and I think that we shouldn't depreciate anything that we don't know about.

How can you not be excited about stock aero, fairings and everything else ? i really don't understand that... (cause I am really looking forward to those ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) )

> 
> Do you realize how absurd what you just said is ? Saying that you will install FAR anyway for 1.0 WHATEVER the stock aero upgrades will be is really the same as saying that you don't trust squad at all and that what they do sucks... Maybe that is what you think, but then why do you even play KSP...?

That is false. I did not say that. I said, taking my assessment of squad's statements and patterns to this point, that I am in no doubt I will not be happy with what Squad is planning. I do not dismiss everything squad does. That's insanity. But we are not talking magic fairies here. Squad doesn't conjure updates out of thin air the night before release. Two months in, the major feature decisions have been made. Statements by Squad at this point are based on those decisions. We can and should understand them to be based on facts about the next release. Perhaps they will better my expectations and I will stick with the stock aero model. Perhaps as soon as I post this they will post something dramatic proving my assessment incorrect. That is a possibility. Imho it is just a very remote possibility.

But we will all see soon enough. Squad is predictable as the tide when it comes to release dates.
